messages.ssml: <speak>To date, the Center for Disease Control and Prevention has not received any reports of pets or other animals becoming sick with <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub>. At this time, there is no evidence that companion animals including pets can spread <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub>. However, since animals can spread other diseases to people, it’s always a good idea to wash your hands after being around animals. </speak>

messages.speech: To date, the Center for Disease Control and Prevention has not received any reports of pets or other animals becoming sick with COVID-19. At this time, there is no evidence that companion animals including pets can spread COVID-19. However, since animals can spread other diseases to people, it’s always a good idea to wash your hands after being around animals.

messages.displayText: To date, the Center for Disease Control and Prevention has not received any reports of pets or other animals becoming sick with COVID-19. At this time, there is no evidence that companion animals including pets can spread COVID-19. However, since animals can spread other diseases to people, it’s always a good idea to wash your hands after being around animals.
